critique: This is an executive order from 1934 exempting a specific individual (W. H. Moran) from mandatory retirement. It's a very specific action with limited scope. It doesn't touch on broad ideological themes, immigration, or social inclusion. It has a slight impact on executive power, as it uses the president's authority to make an exception to a rule. It doesn't directly affect federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, or economic regulation.
